11.title: Ginny Weasley

choices: They are discovered by a teacher/student.
111.content:
"Malfoy what the..." Ginny hissed,
"Shut up Weasley," He murmered, his face creasing into one of deep concentration and focus, "Just shut your mouth for once,"
Ginny stood silent, fuming for a whole second,
"Malfoy, let, me, out," Her voice had become quiet but dangerous and she felt Malfoy bristle,
"Remember that afternoon down by the lake?" Malfoy blurted out, his eyes wild and misty, "When Potter and your...brother caught me alone?"
"Malfoy..." Ginny knew where this was heading and now it was her turn to bristle,
"They were hexing me and...you stopped them, even though..." He shook his head, and looked up, "I'll never forget it,"
They stood silent for a few seconds, each staring at the other, their own thoughts screaming out mutely.
It was Malfoy who made the first move but Ginny reasoned later that she would have done it a moment later. He gathered her in his arms with a firm grip and pulled her lips onto his. They stood, embraced by arms and lips, for what seemed like hours until they finally parted, both too shocked to speak,
"Well..." Ginny finally spluttered, "What happens now Malfoy?"

How had he fell so hard for her over just a short period of time. He has wasted so many years hating her he suddenly realised. When the time finally came for him to meet Ginny. He had been sitting in the common room for way too long. 111231221.content:
"Mr. Malfoy?" Draco turned and jumped when he saw Dumbledore. He gulped. Was he in trouble for his relationship with Ginny?

"Y-Yes, sir?" He ran his hands through his hair and fidgeted some.

"Your father is here and would like to talk to you. I shall escort you up to my office, where he is waiting." Draco nodded, his throat dry. He followed Dumbledore as he strolled through the hallways.

"Sir?" he asked as they came to the gargoyles that led up to Dumbledore's office. "Do you know why he's here?" Dumbledore nodded and turned to him, his eyes grave.

"I do. Draco, he's not very pleased with you." Draco winced, looking away. "I know this is going to be hard for you. You've chosen to be with Ginny these past few weeks, and I think that is a fine choice. Your father, unfortunately, doesn't. Just remember two things. Love is the most powerful force in the universe, and I will always be here for you, just like I am here for any of my students." Heart lighter, Draco turned back to the gargoyles.

"Thank you, Professor," he said, his voice rougher than normal. Dumbledore gave the password and the gargoyles slid away.

"I'll wait here for you, Draco."
111231221.title: He wanted to tell him that his Father was here ...

1112312212.content:
Draco gathered his courage, squared his shoulders, and headed up the stairs.When he reached the top, he didn't even attempt to avoid his father. He'd face it head on. "Hello, Father."

Lucius stood in the middle of the room with his back to Draco, black cloak swept up around him. As he heard this, he turned. His eyes were blazing with rage and his hands were white-knuckled as he clenched them at his sides. "Is it true, Draco?" he asked. His voice was velvet smooth, contrasting with the rest of his body. "Is it true that you and Ginny Weasley are dating?"

Slowly, Draco nodded. "We are, Father. I like her very much." Rage flitted over his father's face before Lucius regained control.

"You don't want to break up with her? It would save you very much trouble."

"No. I - I love her, Father. I can't leave her."

"I hope that she feels the same for you then," he said. "Because you will be needing a place to stay over the summer holidays." Draco stepped back.

"But... What about...?" Lucius's eyes flashed.

"My place? Oh no. You see, I fear that I only let family and friends stay at our house. And since you are not either, there is no place for you at home." Draco staggered back a few more steps. Disbelief filled his face.

"You're... disowning me?" he asked, almost managing to hide the slight catch in his voice. Maybe his parents weren't very nice, but they were his parents.

"Of course. You don't think I could actually let you go out with one of the blood traitors and still call you family? Surely even you aren't that stupid, Draco."

"No..." Draco shook his head slowly.

"Good. For a while you were so promising, but I guess even the best of things can go bad. I hope I never see you again, but if I do, you'll be warned. Stay away from me." Lucius's voice lost its velvet smoothness on the last sentence and Draco could hear the pounding fury and violence in it.

"Yes, sir." Draco turned and headed back down the stairs. As soon as he was out of his father's sight, he slumped against the wall. His head fell forward and he stared hopelessly at his hands. He could feel the tears start to well up. What was he going to do?
1112312212.title: He squares his shoulders and heads up the stairs.

11123122122.content:
After a moment of standing there he forced the tears back. He'd go talk to Ginny. Maybe she could help him. At the very least, she might comfort him. He tried to push a nagging thought out of his head. What if she told him that she'd just been playing with him the last few weeks? That she didn't really like him? No, he told himself. That won't happen.

As he passed Dumbledore, Dumbledore stopped him with a hand on his shoulder. "Draco, are you alright?" He shook Dumbledore's hand off, trying to fight the irrational rage he felt. Dumbledore hadn't done anything to him. His father had.

"I'm fine," he muttered, staring at the floor. "I'm just going to go find Ginny. Okay?" His last words took on a sarcastic, sneering edge. "I don't need to be babysat!"

"Alright, Draco. Watch out, though - your old habits are starting to return. And remember what I told you before you went in." Draco nodded reluctantly and started back down the hall, anxious to get away from Dumbledore and his probing eyes and kind ways. He did try to calm down some more.

He found Ginny in the library, talking quietly with Harry and Ron and Hermione. Draco walked up to them and smiled as confidently as he could. Nervous, he ran his hands through his hair. "Ginny? Can I talk to you?" She looked up, a smile dying from her face as she saw him. Do I really look that bad? I can't look too messed up, he thought. Can I? The others turned to see what was making her so upset and stared at him. He didn't meet any of their gazes.

"Are you okay?" she asked, reaching out one hand to him and touching his elbow. He flinched back some, not ready for anybody - not even her - to touch him right yet.

"Don't touch me!" When he saw the hurt spasm across his face he instantly felt guilty and hopeless. First he couldn't keep his father happy and then he hurt the girl he loved? What kind of a freak was he?

"Hey!" Ron stood up from the table, mouth tight. "You don't talk to my sister like that, Malfoy! And we thought you had changed!" Draco stepped back, a headache pounding at his head. He didn't want to get in a fight.

"Ron, sit down," hissed Hermione, glancing over at Madam Pince.

"I'm sorry, Ginny," Draco said. "Please, can we talk in private?" Ginny glanced nervously at the others, then stood.

"Of course." Her voice only wobbled a little. He followed her out of the library and into one of the deserted classrooms. When they got there, she turned to face him and spoke before he got a chance.

"Are you dumping me?" she asked.
11123122122.title: Go talk to Ginny.

111231221222.content:
Draco pulled back, hurt and stunned. "N-No. Do you want me t-to?" She shook her head, her face much happier.

"I was just worried, the way you looked and acted." She moved closer and reached out to touch him, then pulled back when he flinched away again. Draco wanted to reassure her first, seeing the hurt on her face again. His problems could wait.

"I love you, Ginny," he said. "I'm just not ready to be touched by anybody right now. I'm sorry. I'm just really upset, and..." He could feel himself choking up and turned away from her, trying to hold back more tears.

"What's wrong?" she asked softly. "You know you can tell me." He nodded.

"I... I just talked to my father a few minutes ago, and..." He shook his head, trying to gather up the courage to just spit it out. "He disowned me." There. Finally, he'd said it. Saying it seemed to make it more real, though, and he could really feel tears starting to well up now. Suddenly he needed the comfort Ginny offered. He turned back to her blindly and reached out and then she was there, holding him as he buried his head in her shoulder. She held him as he cried into her, just giving the comfort that someone was there for him.

"Don't worry, Draco," she said.
111231221222.title: No!

choices: Stay in the classroom with Ginny.
1112312212221.content:
"You know I love you." Draco nodded. For a while he just held onto her for dear life, sobbing quietly. After a while he pulled away, wiping his red, swollen eyes.

"I'm sorry, Ginny. I didn't mean to c-cry. I just never realized that - that losing my parents would ever hurt so much. It's not like they were ever really nice to me or showed that they loved me." Ginny bit her lip, then started speaking.

"I don't really know what that's like. My parents have always been there for me and loved me. But I know that I love you and will help you in any way I can. You can count on me for that." Draco smiled weakly at her.

"Thanks. Ummm... I know this isn't the best time, but I know that I'm not going to have anyplace to stay this summer. Do you think - could you...?" He trailed off, embarassed to be asking this ofher.

"Could I what?" Ginny asked, perplexed.

"Ask your parents if I could stay with you this summer?" He stopped then, realizing that what he was saying could be interpreted in the wrong way. "I mean - stay at your house. I know they probably won't want me too, it's not like I've ever been nice to them or you, but... I'll make it up to them, I swear. I'll work around the house if they want, or - or -or do something else for them, or-" Ginny interrupted him.

"Draco, hush. It's okay. I'm sure Mum and Dad will let you stay with us. They might not realize that you've changed at first, but I think they'd give you a chance. For me, at least." Draco smiled, but her words, 'For me, at least,' echoed inside of him. He'd been awful before. Everybody hated him now, except Ginny and maybe Ron and Hermione and Harry, and he deserved it. He'd been mean to everybody not in Slytherin - a complete jerk. And then he betrayed Slytherin by going out with Ginny, a 'blood traitor', as many of them called the Weasleys. He'd have to change that.

"Thanks, Ginny," he said. He smiled at her, realizing how truly lucky he was to be with her.

"Do you want to go back to the library?" she asked him. "You don't have to if you don't feel up to it, I'll stay here with you."
1112312212221.title: I'm sure Mum and Dad will let you stay with...

11123122122211.title: Go back to the library.

choices: Tell them to go away and let them have some privacy!
111231221222111.content:
Draco fidgeted some but didn't say anything. He wanted to leave, but he didn't want to disturb the others. And he especially didn't want to disturb Ginny, not after she'd just done so much for him. Ginny looked over and saw him, though, and put her hand on his knee. "You want to leave?" she asked. He nodded. "Come on then, let's go. We'll find someplace else where we can talk and work at the same time." Ginny started picking up her stuff, and Draco reached out to take it from her.

"I can carry it for you." Ron glanced over, a surprised look on his face, then turned back to his work. Draco noticed this and his face burned. He followed Ginny out into the hallway, where she stopped and looked both ways.

"Where do you want to go?" she asked. "Normally, I'd say the Gryffindor common room, but..." She trailed off.

"Yeah, I know. I'm not in Gryffindor, and even if I was somehow able to get in there, the others would definitely not like me." She nodded.

"I'm sorry," she said softly.

"It's not your fault, Gin. It's mine. I acted like an ass for a long time, and now I'm paying for it. Don't worry about it." He wanted desperately to change the subject, so he blurted out the first place that came to mind. "How about the Room of Requirement?"

"Oh!" Ginny slapped herself in the forehead. "I should have thought of that right away! Oh, my gosh, I feel so stupid now!" She laughed and started trotting down the corridor, pausing at the end to let him catch up.

"Oy! Wait up!" yelled someone from behind them right after they'd started walking again. They stopped and turned. Ron and Harry were running to catch up with them, their bags of books swinging out behind them.

"Thanks for waiting," panted Harry as the caught up. "Do you mind if we come with you?"
111231221222111.title: Go someplace else.

1112312212221111.content:
Ginny opened her mouth and started to say something, then turned and looked at Draco. All eyes rested on him. "Uh - ummm - no?" he said. "I mean, no, we don't mind if you come with us?"

"You mean 'I' don't mind if you come with us, right?" asked Ron, smirking. Draco looked down and reached out one hand to Ginny, shifting her books to his other arm.

"Ron!" Ginny kicked his leg, glaring at him. "Be nice, okay? He's my boyfriend!" Ron reached down and rubbed his shin. He scowled.

"Geez! It's not like he was ever nice to us before," he muttered rebelliously. "Why should I be nice to him now?" Ginny opened her mouth to say some more, but Harry stepped hurriedly in-between them.

"Come on, let's go. Where are we going, anyway?"

"The Room of Requirement," Draco said. Ginny glared some more at Ron, then whirled and stalked off, the others following. They found it and walked back and forth in front of it several times, everybody focusing hard on a place where they could all relax and work on homework together.

154.content:
Draco sat in his bedroom looking out the window; his head on the cold, hard, frost bitten glass. He watched a girl change through the open window and smiled, but it also had him thinking that it was time for him to get a girlfriend. He felt he hadn’t shagged anybody in the past day so he needed someone for twenty-four hour service. He thought about going to an alley, but nothing good comes from there. Then he thought about worldwide wiz web dating. But the girl sometimes ends up being a gay man with a hairy back. All of a sudden, his father came in and told him it was time to go to the train station. Draco scoffed, took one last look at the girl - who knew he was looking and smiled in interest - and left.

Soon he reached the train station where he met up with Crabbe, Goyle, Blaise, and Pansy. He walked his cart into the wall but instead of going through, he hit the wall!! Or at least he thought.
"Ah shit!! Tell me we didn’t miss the fucking God damn train!” he yelled. He felt the wall and his hand went straight through. He stuck his head through the wall to see a girl on the floor; her thong revealing under her mini skirt. Draco smiled quickly. The girl began to get up.
"What the hell is wrong with you?” he demanded “Are you fucking stupid or something? I mean seriously what the Hell!!” Draco continued to curse.
"Okay, seriously, dude, you need to calm down. What's the big deal?" she retorted as Draco walked in fully with his cart.
"Don’t tell me what to do you filthy Half-Blood!" he snapped.
"Um, correction...I’m a fucking pure blood, Malfoy, with your stupid blond fucking hair, so you need to just go on 'bout cha' business and leave me the hell alone. Okay?" she sassed, walking away, her mini skirt swaying side to side back and forth with attitude.
"My name's Draco." he said to himself.
Blaise, Crabbe, Goyle, and Pansy caught up.
"Hey man who was that?" Blaise asked.
"I don't know, mate. But she's hot." Draco replied.
"Is she pure?" Blaise asked.
"Yeah." Draco said.
"Does she look like me?" Pansy asked.
"Nothing alike." Draco replied looking at her until her figure faded in with the steam from the train’s engine.
"Then I hate her." Pansy said.
"Okay..." Draco said.
